speaker.name: Nick Parker
speaker.title: The end to the death sentence
speaker.info: A real case insight into how the specifics of living the right lifestyle choices can give our bodies everything they need to reverse a chronic health condition.

speaker.name: Juliet Norman
speaker.title: One Diet Bunkum
speaker.info: There is so much dietary advice 'out there', much of it ill-informed, old hat or with hidden bias. And there is so much more than what you put into your mouth, or donâ€™t! Learn the rock-solid foundations on which to build your bio-individual nutrition plan.

speaker.name: Nikki Jackson
speaker.title: Mind matters most
speaker.info: Everything starts in the mind. Hear how our minds are battling with an impossible task that translates into physical disease and understand what we can do to address the 'monkey mind'.

speaker.name: Jess Goyder
speaker.title: Lessons from recovery
speaker.info: A wild adventure of mobility scooters, far-flung places and not 'doing' very much at all - what can an ongoing recovery story from Chronic Fatigue Syndrome teach us about how to live our lives?

speaker.name: Michi Naomoto
speaker.title: East Meets West
speaker.info: There is an increasing belief that traditional Eastern medical approaches are more suited to correcting our Western health pandemics. Gain insight into the solutions time has forgotten and discover how we can harness these therapies for ourselves.

speaker.name: Louise Blyth
speaker.title: He heard my cry
speaker.info: Is it possible to lose the love of your life but gain the greatest love you can ever know? Can life be found in death? Hear a personal story about how grief can lead to spiritual hope.

speaker.name: David Shadlock
speaker.title: Move That Booty
speaker.info: Our bodies were never built for sedentary lifestyles. Many of us think we know how to exercise, but new science is telling us we have much of it wrong. Learn the science behind moving and how we can do everything needed in the day, whether a 'gym bunny' or not.

speaker.name: Leo Campbell
speaker.title: Slow And Fermented
speaker.info: Slow, fermented and local! If food is to be our medicine, then learn what we are looking for when buying or preparing food and achieve great gut health.

speaker.name: Karina Athwal
speaker.title: Practise hormone love
speaker.info: When in proper working order our bodies function like well-oiled machines. To do this, they rely on hormones playing an essential role in our biological processes. Understand what this means for all of us, even when we are not part of the menopausal, pregnant or teenage populations.
